channel.title: Rtems on What The Blog?
channel.description: Recent content in Rtems on What The Blog?

item.title: Introduction to my GSoC project: An RTEMS x86-64 port
item.description: RTEMS is an RTOS which can run on tons of architectures and processor families within those architectures. However, the modern Intel x86-64 / AMD64 is not one of the currently supported architectures. <infomerical time> Have you ever wanted to try a new operating system for your project, but all the emulators for your target processor support a limited number of features, and you really don’t want to have to test it all on your hardware?

item.title: The Journey to GSoC 2018 - just the beginning
item.description: Here I’ll document some of the preperatory tasks I undertook as part of my proposal to RTEMS (AN RTOS THAT’S BEEN TO SPACE! SPAAAAAAAAAACE!). The Hunt To start at the beginning, I’m going to have to just say that finding an organization that piques your interest and needs a project that hits just the sweet-spot in “I have most of the skills to do this, but I’ll still need to learn and grow a lot to bring it to fruition” is hard.
